alert.note: Alert for Tavaputs Plateau (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 28 at 1:41PM MST until March 02 at 5:00AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING ABOVE 7500 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 AM MST THURSDAY ABOVE 7000 FEET... * WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory above 7500 feet, blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the second Winter Weather Advisory above 7000 feet, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Tavaputs Plateau. * WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM MST this evening. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 11 PM this evening to 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility, especially on ridge tops. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. A detailed map of the snowfall can be found at: www.weather.gov/gjt/winter.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
